Analyze Relative Risk Distribution

Source: R/cutoff_rr_analysis.R
analyze_rr_distribution.Rd

Analyzes the distribution of relative risk (RR) values in a mobility matrix and suggests natural cut-off values based on the distribution.

Usage

analyze_rr_distribution(mx, small.cell.reduction = 0, symmetric = TRUE)

Arguments

mx

Mobility matrix with marginals in last row/column

small.cell.reduction

Numeric value for small cell adjustment

symmetric

Logical, whether to make the RR matrix symmetric

Value

List containing: - summary: Statistical summary of RR values - quantiles: Decile breakdown of RR distribution - density_curve: Density object for RR distribution - suggested_cutoffs: Named vector of suggested cut-off values

Examples

# Generate synthetic mobility data
data <- generate_mobility_data(n_classes = 4, seed = 123)

# Analyze RR distribution
rr_analysis <- analyze_rr_distribution(data)
print(rr_analysis)
#> Relative Risk Distribution Analysis
#> =====================================
#> Number of RR values: 12 
#> Range: 0.220 to 1.695 
#> 
#> Summary Statistics:
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>  0.2200  0.6321  1.2207  1.0515  1.3209  1.6946 
#> 
#> Suggested Cut-off Values:
#>   median: 1.221
#>   mean: 1.051
#>   q75: 1.321
#>   q90: 1.657
#>   natural_break: 0.373

# Access suggested cut-offs
suggested_cutoffs <- rr_analysis$suggested_cutoffs
print(suggested_cutoffs)
#>        median          mean           q75           q90 natural_break 
#>     1.2206708     1.0514981     1.3209490     1.6572406     0.3729055
